result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Fortin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard A Fortin Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard A Fortin Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Fortin Jr.

records.addlTxt:
2:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Fortin Jr. appeared by video in custody from Eau Claire County jail.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appeared by video for Richard A Fortin Jr. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CM268, 22CF32
Court - has rcvd plea documents.
Atty Tomtschik - DE will plea today. Client waives personal appearance and preliminary hearing.
Court - provides colloquy for preliminary hearing. Finds DE knowingly waived the preliminary hearing. Information was filed. 
DE - waives prelim.
State - plea to 21CM268. W/held sentence. 1 year probation. Absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through. Costs of $473.00. Concurrent to Ct 1 in 22CF32.
Plea to Ct 1 in 22CF32 w/held sent. 2 years probation. absolute sobriety. AODA follow thru. Costs of $538. Probation concurrent to 21CM268. Ct 2 of 22CF32 is dismissed.
Court - provides plea colloquy.
Atty Tomtschik - stipulates to the enhancer in 21CM268 and Ct 1 in 22CF32.
DE - enters Guilty plea to 21CM268. Enters Guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CF32.
Parties stipulate to the facts.
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 of 22CF32 and 21CM268.
State - asks court to accept joint recommendation. No restitution requested.
Atty Tomtschik - agrees court should accept joint recommendation. 3 days credit on 21CM268. 69 days credit on 22CF32.
DE - makes a statement to the court.

Court orders -
22CF32 Count 1
w/held sent. 
2 years probation. 
absolute sobriety. 
AODA follow thru. 
Follow recommendations of agent.
Costs of $538. 
Probation concurrent to 21CM268. 
69 days jail credit if revoked
Ct 2 of 22CF32 is dismissed.

21CM268
W/held sentence. 
1 year probation. 
Absolute sobriety. 
AODA and follow through. 
Follow recommendations of agent.
Costs of $473.00. Concurrent to Ct 1 in 22CF32.
3 days jail credit if revoked
Amended from $200 cash bond to a $500 sign bond. Not to be in presence of drug paraphernalia.
Amended from a $200 cash bond to a $500 sign bond.  Not to be in presence of drug paraphernalia.
Amended from a $200 cash bond to a $500 sign bond. Not to be in presence of drug paraphernalia.

11:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard A Fortin Jr. appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appeared by video for Richard A Fortin Jr. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Court - makes record of request.
State - no objection to bond modification.
Court - orders bond be modified to a $500 sign bond with other conditions to remain.
Bail/bond hearing on April 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.

01:14 PM Defendant, Richard A Fortin with Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  B. Bahr - Clerk
Atty Lundeen - has not rcvd complaint.
State - requests $500 cash bond. Not to be in presence of drug para. DE is on a PO hold.
Atty Lundeen - argues for sign bond. Br 2 case is resolved - has ct in Br 2 on 3-8-22. DE is now employed full time.
Court - orders $200 cash bond.  Not to be in presence of drug para.
Atty Lundeen - if Complaint is rcvd today can do INIT tomorrow.
State - objects. Set for INIT on regular schedule.
Court - sets INIT.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
